comments:
This is a bug difficult to reproduce. Since I've been using 3.1M5a+WTP1.0M3, it
has happened to me several times, but in a somewhat casual way.
I've noticed two variants of it, however.
Description follows.

1st variant.

At times, with no recognizable (by me, at least) cause, an error dialog pops up
stating that "an error has occurred".
Pressing OK or the "X" (close window) icon does not make the dialog go away.
After several (10-12?) clicks on "OK" or "X" icon another dialogs appears, at
last, stating that the error is severe and offering to save the workspace and
exit in order to avoid likely loss of work.
Accepting this option will save the workspace correctly (as it appears) and then
quits eclipse, which closes with a last dialog telling the user to look at the
logfiles.
By the way, I noticed that, sometimes, after the workspace has been saved and
the main eclipse windows have closed, the eclipse.exe+jawaw.exe processes still 
remain active for a while (even 2 minutes), before the final dialog appears
(that telling to look at the logfiles).

2nd variant (rarer).

This time the problems occurs while browsing/changing the preferences in the
eclipse preference dialog.
The error dialog shows up in a casual way, sometimes when applying preferences,
sometimes when just browsing them.
The problem is similar, but this time the error dialog doesn't go away pressing
OK or "X" several times. The only way to solve the crash is to shut down eclipse
using the task manager.

I just experienced this last variant, so I'm attaching below the last portin of
the log file. 
I don't know if I should attach the whole logfile (which is 12M long) or a
section of it, so I'm refraining in order not to clog bugzilla. 
If requested I can send you the whole logfile.
Thanks.


------------------ Log file excerpt ------------
